prompt:
Generate a video illustrating quicksort on an array of twelve numbers 
from 0 to 11, showing partition around a pivot and recursive subarrays.

storyboard.global_style: Clean flat 2D animation with a pale background. Each number is inside a rounded rectangle card.

keyframes.0: A row of twelve cards on a pale background, numbers 0 to 11 in random order.
keyframes.1000: Highlight the rightmost card (11) as the pivot. Cards are unchanged.
keyframes.2000: Show a divider moving from left to right, comparing each card to the pivot and rearranging: smaller numbers to the left, larger to the right.
keyframes.4000: Pivot (11) moves to its correct position, between smaller and larger numbers. Divider separates the array into two subarrays.
keyframes.6000: Focus on the left subarray. Highlight a new pivot. Right subarray is dimmed.
keyframes.8000: Repeat partitioning process on the left subarray, moving smaller numbers to the left of the pivot.
keyframes.10000: Pivot in the left subarray moves to its correct position. Two new subarrays are formed on its sides.
keyframes.12000: Shift focus to the right subarray from the initial partition. Highlight a new pivot. Left array is dimmed.
keyframes.14000: Repeat partitioning process on this right subarray, separating smaller and larger numbers around the pivot.
keyframes.16000: Pivot in the right subarray moves to its correct position. Final position of all numbers is nearly sorted.
keyframes.18000: All cards animate into their correct sorted positions from 0 to 11, showcasing a complete quicksort.
